duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct technical support with local market engineers and board ops when necessary.
Monitor automated and end user incidents, troubleshoot, and resolve problems remotely.
Create reports on up-time, equipment failures, backup transmission site utilization, and other key metrics.
Proactively monitor the on-air automation systems and the critical elements of technical infrastructure.
Seek out issues with a constant eye on each individual market and their technical systems, identifying potential problems before they impact the consumer product.
Monitor the operation of broadcast radio stations and streaming equipment.
Assist in the development and organization of NOC programs as they are being developed and built.
Communicate with local market engineers on a regular basis, assuring they are attuned to the NOC procedures and actions taken in their respective markets.
Work directly with the Audio Streaming department, monitoring streams and providing triage support on streaming audio delivery.
Keeps birds-eye, over watching view of the entire company’s technical operations.
Actively seek out issues with a constant eye on each individual market and their technical systems, learning the patterns and identifying potential problems before they impact the consumer product.

education_certification.credential: Two to Four years of college or technical school and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with digital audio and audio streaming.
Broadcast Facilities knowledge and maintenance experience.
